intro: Oxytropis sacciformis, commonly known as the bladderpod milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of western North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, small yellow flowers, and distinctive inflated seed pods that resemble bladders. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Oxytropis sacciformis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native environment.
